title: The WORST Game Of League I have ever played! Seriously Horrible
body:
This happened Exactly 20 minutes ago, It was so bad i was actually tempted to delete my account and say bye to the game.. I never thought id have this reaction. 

It all started in the loading screen where i could see my ping suddenly skyrocketing. Never a good start. Everything was fine for 5 minutes or so until Me and 2 other members from my team started disconnecting at the same time. At first I thought it was a very strange coinidence and I didnt start blaming DDos or hacks... But then Everything in the game started to freeze and my Screen went Completly Black. All i could see was my cursor (i also could hear the audio). Then whiles i was rushing to try and solve the problem i heard 3 people disconnect from my team.

Once it was "solved" (i had to fully restart my pc) ..  the enemy Xayah started hardcore BMing my team, Killing them when someone randomly stopped walking and typing "ez noobs" . This also continued in the post game lobby where the situation got extremly toxic. 

I just wanted to have a chill / fun night of league of legends, and after this one game, thats no longer the plan. Yes, I am extremly salty so save your comments calling me out. 

2 Weeks ago I posted a discussion in the boards about how i was "pleasantly surprised by the community" ... Its Facinating how one experience can ruin your mindset for i dont know how long.

Xayah or one of her premades was 100% hacking and I seriously hope she gets Perma-Banned. 

Yeah, That was My rant! what was the worst experience youve had? {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

I wouldn't argue that the connection coding is poorly optimized when it is working, which is most of the time, but there are definitely some big issues, the most common being the dialog that pops up during the loading screen which tells you to check your Internet connection and firewall. This message is presented to users without Internet connectivity or firewall blocking issues.

For the average user, restarting the computer is the way to fix this issue. Those of us who know a bit more about networking can fix this by using a different IP address, which points to the issue being on Riot's side.

On that note, it was more than a bit snarky and unbecoming of you to ask for the credentials of someone to determine whether the person **has the technical capacity to experience technical difficulties which are solved at runtime by other games seamlessly without the average user having to reboot his or her computer**.

Observing packet transmission and seeing no response from server despite being able to reach the server by IP and port as supplied by Riot support is not against the ToS and does objectively diagnose the issue.

So, you've diagnosed that you can *connect* to the server, but the *packets* are not being transmitted. That still doesn't say *where* the problem is occurring in the networking pathway.

Coming from someone who has perused the Help/Support boards for well over a year now, when people run diagnostics and post the results, complaining "everything else is fine but Riot", and that "i can connect but I can't connect", lo and behold virtually every time their ISP or their home connection is for whatever reason dropping the packets - not Riot.

You have fundamental misunderstandings about networking processes.

TCP/IP protocol requires an ACK (ACKnowledge) message when a packet is sent to determine that the packet reached its destination. If it does not reach the destination, no ACK message is received by the requesting device and so the connection is broken.

Given such:

* If you can connect to the server, then packets are being transmitted in both directions and are reaching both destinations.

* If the server fails to respond to a request from the client, that does not mean that packets are being dropped, as above. That means that the server either did not know how to process the message or did not respond due to an error or timeout internal to the server.

There are some specific times when it is only my connection specific to league that is experiencing issues. I'll run ping tests to one of their servers (IP address is somewhere online) and have no packet loss or high ping, yet in game I'm bouncing between 100-300 ms. Sometimes, exiting out of the game and client and relaunching it helps. Other times, it doesn't. If I queue for another game, my ping is suddenly normal 100% of the time (given that I've verified my connection is good through the ping command). Coincidence? I don't believe so myself.

As far as I know, this doesn't happen with any other game I play. Most of the time, I get a lag spike and by the time I run a ping command in the command prompt the lag is gone. If my internet is actually having issues, the ping command usually verifies it.

It's hard for me not to personally assume it's something on Riot's end. I'm not an expert in this field, but you can see where your average person is going to blame something on Riot's networking and connection setup if they experience the same issues I do.

With all that being said, I do think the networking is overall pretty good, but there are some strange issues that occasionally come up from my personal experience.
